item.title: Clientless Web Isolation
item.description: Clientless Web IsolationClientless Web Isolation allows users to securely navigate high risk or sensitive websites in a remote browser without having to install the Cloudflare WARP client on their device. ​​ Set up Clientless Web Isolation In the Zero Trust dashboard External link icon Open external link , navigate to Settings > Browser Isolation. Toggle on Clientless Web Isolation. To configure permissions, click Manage. You can add authentication methods and rules to control who can access the remote browser.

item.title: Non-identity on-ramps
item.description: Non-identity on-rampsWith Cloudflare Zero Trust, you can isolate HTTP traffic from on-ramps such as proxy endpoints or Magic WAN. Since these on-ramps do not require users to log in to Cloudflare WARP, identity-based policies are not supported. If you want to apply Isolate policies based on user identity, you will need to either install the WARP client or manually redirect users to the Clientless Web Isolation URL. ​​ Set up non-identity browser isolation Install the Cloudflare certificate on your devices.
